How Do I Return a Rented Printer?

July 1, 2025 Marga Enterprises

Renting a printer is a smart, flexible solution for many businesses and individuals who want the convenience of a high-quality printing machine without the long-term commitment. But what happens when the rental period ends? How do I return a rented printer? This is a common question—and the answer is simpler than you might think.

In this guide, we’ll walk you through the step-by-step process of returning a rented printer, what to expect, what to prepare, and how to avoid extra fees. Whether you're wrapping up a short-term event rental or ending a long-term lease, this article is for you.

Understanding Your Printer Rental Agreement

Before diving into the return process, it’s essential to check your printer rental agreement. This document outlines your responsibilities and what steps you need to take when returning the unit.

Learn more: What Is Included in a Printer Rental Agreement?

Key points to review in your agreement:

  • End-of-contract procedure

  • Return location and method

  • Condition expectations

  • Possible return fees

  • Required notice period

Knowing these details ahead of time will help you avoid misunderstandings and ensure a smooth return process.

Step-by-Step Guide to Returning a Rented Printer

1. Notify the Rental Provider

The first step in returning a rented printer is informing your provider. Most companies require a notice period—often 7 to 30 days—before the scheduled return date. This allows them to schedule pickup or coordinate logistics if the return is your responsibility.

Reach out via email or phone and include:

  • Your company or personal name

  • Contract number (if applicable)

  • Printer model and serial number

  • Preferred return date

Being proactive helps avoid penalties or automatic contract renewals.

2. Prepare the Printer for Return

Next, prepare the printer. Rental companies expect the printer to be returned in good working condition, aside from normal wear and tear. Here’s how to prepare:

  • Clean the printer: Wipe off dust, fingerprints, and toner smudges.

  • Remove paper and consumables: Take out paper trays and any unused ink or toner.

  • Power down and unplug: Turn off the machine and disconnect all cords.

  • Gather accessories: Include power cables, USB cords, manuals, and trays that came with the unit.

TIP: If you rented a multifunction printer, make sure the scanner lid, feeder, and copier features are working and intact.

3. Schedule Pickup or Drop-Off

Depending on your agreement, you may either:

  • Drop off the printer at the rental provider’s office, or

  • Schedule a pickup by the rental company.

If you're unsure, refer back to your rental contract or contact customer service.

If pickup is scheduled:

  • Confirm the date and time.

  • Make sure someone is available to assist.

  • Have the printer packed or ready for transport (some providers offer packing service).

4. Request a Return Receipt or Acknowledgment

Once the printer is returned, always ask for proof. This may be:

  • A signed acknowledgment form

  • A digital return confirmation email

  • A copy of the final invoice showing the return

This documentation protects you in case of any disputes or damage claims later on.

5. Settle Final Payments or Charges

Some contracts include a final inspection. If the printer is damaged beyond normal use, you may be billed for repair or replacement. Also, check for any:

  • Outstanding balances

  • Unreturned accessories

  • Extended rental fees (if returned late)

Clear these promptly to avoid additional charges.

What If the Printer Is Damaged?

Minor scratches or wear are expected, but significant damage—like broken trays, scanner issues, or ink spills—can incur charges. Take these steps if your rented printer has damage:

  • Take photos of the current condition before return.

  • Notify the provider in advance and explain what happened.

  • Check your rental insurance if included.

Some companies offer accidental damage coverage within their rental terms, while others don’t.

Can I Extend My Rental Instead?

Not ready to return the printer yet? You can often extend your rental by contacting the provider. Most companies offer flexible terms, whether you want to extend for a few weeks or convert to a long-term lease.

Learn more: How Long Can I Rent a Printer For?

Be sure to renegotiate your rate and get written confirmation of your extension.

What Happens After I Return the Printer?

After the printer is returned:

  1. The provider inspects the unit.

  2. You receive a final invoice (if applicable).

  3. Any refundable deposits are processed.

  4. The contract is officially closed.

It’s also a good time to review your printing needs and decide if you need a different printer model or upgraded plan for the future.

Explore your options: What Types of Printers Can I Rent?

Avoiding Common Return Mistakes

Here are common mistakes to avoid when returning a rented printer:

  • Forgetting to give notice (can lead to automatic renewal or late fees)

  • Returning without accessories

  • Not documenting the return

  • Ignoring the cleaning and prep step

Following the checklist above will help you stay organized and protected.

Final Thoughts

Returning a rented printer doesn’t have to be stressful. The key is understanding your agreement, preparing the machine properly, and communicating with your rental provider. If you're still wondering, “How do I return a rented printer?”—just follow the simple steps we’ve outlined, and you’ll have a hassle-free experience.

Printer rental remains a cost-effective solution for short-term and long-term use. Whether you’re looking to rent again or trying a new type of machine, you’re already on the right track by staying informed.

Need a refresher? Check this out: What Is Printer Rental?
